title: Week 13 NFL picks
author: VD
content_html:
Last week: 10-6. Fantasy 9-3.

W-Indianapolis Colts over Tennessee Titans
Seattle Seahawks over Philadelphia Eagles
W-San Diego Chargers over Oakland Raiders
W-Chicago Bears over Green Bay Packers
W-Minnesota Vikings over Detroit Lions
W-New England Patriots over New York Jets
W-Miami Dolphins over Buffalo Bills
L-Denver Broncos over Kansas City Chiefs
L-Dallas Cowboys over New York Giants
W-Cincinnati Bengals over Pittsburgh Steelers
W-Baltimore Ravens over Houston Texans
W-Tampa Bay Buccaneers over New Orleans Saints
W-Jacksonville Jaguars over Cleveland Browns
W-Washington Redskins over St. Louis Rams
W-Carolina Panthers over Atlanta Falcons
L-San Francisco 49ers over Arizona Cardinals














And speaking of why Mike Tice should have been fired around this time last year, please note that even an NFL linebacker is capable of outthinking the man who is still mysteriously the Vikings head coach. Miami had the second worst run defense in the league last year, giving up an average of 143.9 yards per game, and Minnesota had three decent running backs who were healthy. Naturally, Tice ran the ball a grand total of TWELVE times, if I recall correctly, thus managing to provide the Dolphins with one of their four victories that year.

Here, it’s just a matter of how bad the Houston run defense is. Houston linebacker Antwan Peek said it best – “if you don’t run on us, you should be fired.”

Last week: 10-6.  Fantasy 9-3.
W-Indianapolis Colts over Tennessee Titans
Seattle Seahawks over Philadelphia Eagles
W-San Diego Chargers over Oakland Raiders
W-Chicago Bears over Green Bay Packers

W-Jacksonville Jaguars over Cleveland Browns
W-Washington Redskins over St. Louis Rams
W-Carolina Panthers over Atlanta Falcons
L-San Francisco 49ers over Arizona Cardinals
And speaking of why Mike Tice should have been fired around this time last year, please note that even an NFL linebacker is capable of outthinking the man who is still mysteriously the Vikings head coach.  Miami had the second worst run defense in the league last year, giving up an average of 143.9 yards per game, and Minnesota had three decent running backs who were healthy.  Naturally, Tice ran the ball a grand total of TWELVE times, if I recall correctly, thus managing to provide the Dolphins with one of their four victories that year.
Here, it’s just a matter of how bad the Houston run defense is. Houston linebacker Antwan Peek said it best – “if you don’t run on us, you should be fired.”
